alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:21PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Moffat and northwestern Rio Blanco Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Rangely, or 40 miles southeast of Vernal, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea-sized to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dinosaur. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 25. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah near mile marker 174. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 21, and between mile markers 25 and 29. Colorado 139 between mile markers 71 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
